New Records: The Yankees became only the fourth team in baseball history and the first since 1970 to avoid a sweep in the World Series when down, 3-0.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the third inning.
Austin Wells launched a solo shot in the sixth inning.
Gleyber Torres hit a three-run homer in the eighth inning.
Aaron Judge hit an RBI single in the eighth inning.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run homer in the first inning.
Will Smith hit a leadoff homer in the fifth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts discussed the importance of length from rookie pitchers Ben Casparius and Landon Knack.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of getting to the next game.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed excitement for the opportunity in Game 5.
Anthony Volpe described his grand slam as the coolest moment of his life.
Austin Wells highlighted the importance of getting a lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium with 49,354 fans in attendance.
The Yankees bullpen held off the Dodgers after gaining the lead.
The Dodgers used rookie pitchers Ben Casparius and Landon Knack in the game.
